main_definition: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) is the mean solar time at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, London, used as a standard reference point for timekeeping and coordinating global activities.

meanings_and_examples.example: The meeting was scheduled at 3 PM GMT to ensure all participants were in the same time.
When discussing international flights, pilots often refer to departure and arrival times using Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), which is equivalent to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).
The pilot announced that the flight would depart at 2:30 PM GMT, aligning with aviation'utc'.
